name: Furama City Centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of the 5 hotels we had booked for our jaunt to the Far East the Furama was probably the one we most looking forward to, after all ,the reviews we had read were on the whole positive. So we were a little let down after our 5 nights stay there.
reviews.title: Nice room, miserable front desk

reviews.text: The Furama is overall a decent tourist/business hotel with enough facilites to keep you happy. The room itself was failry spacious with nice attached ensuite. The room was clean and had nice views of surrounding Singapore Business district.
reviews.title: Horrible hotel

reviews.text: Were the Furama fell down on was its not so approachable front desk staff. It costs nothing to be approachable to guests and to at least offer a smile. It semed like whenever we asked them for assistance there was a reluctance to be helpful and any repsonses given were not done out of genuine care for the Customer.
reviews.title: Excellant Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby area itself was not an appealing place. Clealry 80's in design and well past its sell by date, the place was like a mausoleam, dark and depressing. I mean at least turn some lights on!. Perhaps this funeral like atomsphere rubs off on the staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.liked: — Great location to MRT and Chinatown, clean and hassle free.
likes.disliked: — The entrance was down a side street.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that the hotel does have a nice pool area and cannot be faulted on location ( 5 minutes walk to both Clarke Quay and Chinatown).
reviews.title: Close to Chinatown and Clarke Quay

likes.liked: — Proximity to Chinatown and Clarke Quay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a 3* this hotel is very good, I was a bit put off on my first night when we went for a walk, and round the corner the first thing we saw was a cockroach and the largest rat I’ve ever seen, and that’s saying something, considering I grew up in the country! But anyhow I figured it was outside the hotel, and not inside, but that was the only rat I saw around the hotel during our 5 nights stay. The hotel itself was lovely, the rooms were big considering it’s in the middle of the city, and also having a walk in showing was very nice addition. The view of Chinatown all lit up was great. Right across the road is Chinatown MRT, which was very easy to find our way round, and also we were just a short walk from Boat Quay, where all the night spots are, and the most amazing chilli crab from Jumbo Seafood. Shopping was so tempting, we were there during the great sale. Food is wonderful, we ate once in the hotel, it was average, but we much prefer finding our own food and the many interesting eating food court around Singapore.
reviews.title: Not bad for a 3*

reviews.text: I have just returned from a week long business trip to Singapore during which time I stayed at the Furama Hotel, City Centre.
reviews.title: Good Hotel with a great location.

likes.liked: — Friendly helpful staff and great value

reviews.text: Overall I had a positive stay there. My room, whilst just a standard one was more than adequate during my stay. It was kept very clean by housekeeping and was serviced early in the day meaning fresh bedding and towels by early afternoon.
reviews.title: Enjoyable if you want to be in Chinatown

reviews.text: As advised on here I requested a room away from the elevators, wise advice indeed. I discovered when I was using a room on my last day to have a shower (The hotel provides this service free if you have a late flight leaving Singapore after you have checked out) that was next to the lifts that they are pretty noisy and can be heard clearly through the wall.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: Another tip I picked up here and would also recommend is to buy your water downstairs at the store round the front of the hotel run by the older guy who also sells electronic goods. He has a fridge in his staore and charges SGD $1 for bottles water compared with the hotel price of SGD $4 from the mini bar
reviews.title: Another enjoyable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: To be fair, we only stayed here for one night, but we had a good experience.
reviews.title: exceeded our expectations

reviews.text: This was mainly because, upon arrival, we were told we'd been upgraded to a suite (no idea why, especially since we'd booked the cheapest possible room!). But our room was huge, and even had 2 toilets!
reviews.title: Great hotel, great value

likes.disliked: — Wish our stay could have been longer!

reviews.title: We loved Singapore !
reviews.text: The staff were helpful, breakfast was adequate, and the pool area was fine, but I suspect the main reason to stay in this hotel is not for the breakfast or the pool, but for the location. It's really well placed, in the heart of things, and very close to a subway station, which makes it very handy.
If our room hadn't been upgraded, we'd have probably thought the hotel was 'fine', but the free upgrade really made our stay.
reviews.title: Good Hotel
Average Hotel
reviews.text: We had a great stay at the Furama City Center hotel. We were there for only one night, but we wish it could have been longer. The hotel location is fantastic- walking distance to Chinatown and the Boat Quay/Clarke Quay area. It’s close to the Chinatown metro stop, which is only a few stops from Orchard Road. The hotel itself looks brand new. The room was not huge, but very bright, clean and modern looking.
We had been advised to stay at Furama City Centre by an Aussie travel agent, who makes it his stop each visit home. We were very glad we did for the following reasons:
reviews.title: Fantastic Location. Great Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Price: we had two children under 12 who were free and cost of the adults were excellent
reviews.title: Average Hotel

likes.disliked: — Smell of carpets in common areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Fantastic. Especially if you travel with Singapore airlines and use the free hop on/hop off bus. You could walk to Clarke Quay in a few moments with lots of bars and restaurants or chinatown the other way in minutes. We walked to Orchard Rd (about half an hour with children) but taxis are so cheap that only cost £2 return.
reviews.title: Near Chinatown

reviews.text: Rooms: Spacious. Had two rooms with connecting doors so felt like a suite. Very very clean. Huge bathrooms and good views.
reviews.title: Wonderful location and friendly staff

likes.disliked: — decor in places such as corridors could do with a revamp

reviews.text: Hotel: Food in restaurant very good and staff excellent.
reviews.title: great location
